triples.name: Matthews correlation coefficient
triples.relevance: The paper proposes MCC as the most reliable single metric for evaluating binary classifiers and recommends it as a standard measure across all fields.

triples.name: Confusion matrix
triples.relevance: The paper evaluates metrics that summarize two-class confusion matrices, which contain true positives, true negatives, false positives, and false negatives.

triples.name: Binary classification
triples.relevance: The paper focuses on evaluating binary (two-class) classification performance, which is a fundamental task in machine learning.

triples.name: Balanced accuracy
triples.relevance: The paper compares MCC against balanced accuracy as an alternative metric for evaluating binary classifiers on imbalanced datasets.

triples.name: F-score
triples.relevance: The paper compares MCC to the F1 score, showing that MCC is more informative for binary classification evaluation.

triples.name: Accuracy (classification)
triples.relevance: The paper contrasts MCC with standard accuracy, which can be misleading on imbalanced datasets.

triples.name: Youden's J statistic
triples.relevance: The paper identifies Youden's J statistic (informedness) as another related metric with specific use cases for classifier evaluation.
